text: Thomas Garrett Cavanagh (March 24, 1982 – January 6, 2011) was an American professional ice hockey center. Cavanagh played 18 games in the National Hockey League (NHL). He played with the San Jose Sharks. Before he played in the NHL, he played 4 years of college hockey at Harvard University. During his time there, he was named the ECAC Hockey Best Defensive Forward in the 2004–05 season. He was drafted with the 182nd overall pick by the San Jose Sharks in the 2001 NHL Entry Draft. During his time with the San Jose Sharks, he set a franchise record for the quickest point scored by a rookie when he assisted on a Joe Thornton goal that came 36 seconds into Cavanagh's first game in the NHL. He was also the Worcester Sharks' all-time scoring leader with 138 points in 202 games. On January 6, 2011, Cavanagh was found dead in the parking garage of Providence Place Mall. He locked his car and jumped from an upper level to his death. The police said that his death was a suicide. He had been diagnosed with schizophrenia and was put into institutions during the last months of his life. ==References== ==Other websites== * * Category:1982 births Category:2011 deaths Category:American ice hockey centers Category:Cleveland Barons (2001–2006) players Category:Harvard University alumni Category:Manchester Monarchs (AHL) players Category:People from Warwick, Rhode Island Category:People with schizophrenia Category:San Jose Sharks players Category:Sportspeople from Rhode Island Category:Sportspeople who committed suicide Category:Suicides by jumping in the United States Category:Springfield Falcons players Category:Worcester Sharks players
title: Tom Cavanagh (ice hockey)
